Load TidyTuesday datasets from GitHub by title

load_tt_data.Rd

Filters an internal dataset all_tt_combined by title, and loads associated data files using appropriate methods depending on data_type. Supports functional error handling and logging.

Usage

load_tt_data(title, log_file = NULL)

Arguments

title

A character string matching the title field in all_tt_combined.

log_file

Optional path to a log file (default: NULL). Logs are written using logr_msg() with level-specific formatting.

Value

A named list of tibbles or data frames (one per file). Failed or skipped datasets are excluded.

Features

  • Automatically selects the correct reader (csv, tsv, xlsx, rds)

  • Logs messages using logr_msg()

  • Adds a clean_title attribute to each dataset

  • Skips unsupported formats (vgz, zip, NA)

Supported file types

  • "csv" / "csv.gz" → vroom::vroom()

  • "tsv" → vroom::vroom()

  • "xlsx" → readxl::read_excel()

  • "rds" → readRDS() from a URL connection

Unsupported

  • "vgz", "zip", or NA → skipped with error logging

Examples

load_tt_data("posit::conf talks")
#> INFO [2025-07-03 18:11:13] Starting import for conf2023.csv from https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/refs/heads/main/data/2025/2025-01-14/conf2023.csv
